projects.title: CodeCell Live
projects.description: Real-time collaborative IDE that executes code inside isolated Firecracker microVMs orchestrated by a Go backend. React/TypeScript + Monaco UI with live presence; tRPC API and WebSocket streaming. Fast snapshot boot, per-session filesystem, and resource quotas for safety; currently Python-only, with multi-language support on the roadmap.

projects.title: Recon tool
projects.description: Designed a local web recon pipeline (React/Express/Flask, Nmap, Playwright) that discovers open services and pages, streams real-time progress, and outputs structured JSON for analysis. Shipped with team of three; emphasized safe, authorized-only scanning and a smooth developer UX.

projects.title: Porfolio Website
projects.description: A modern and responsive portfolio website built with React and Material-UI. This project is designed to present my professional experience, skills, and projects in a smooth, user-friendly, and visually appealing manner. It provides a seamless experience for visitors to explore my journey and contact me effortlessly.

projects.title: Polyscope
projects.description: Contributed to enhancing the official university newspaper website, Le Polyscope, by designing and implementing new features using React and Firebase. Collaborated with a team to improve the user experience through responsive interfaces built with Material-UI. Gained hands-on experience in Agile development, sprint planning, and GitLab version control.

about_me: I’m a software engineering student at Polytechnique Montréal who loves building useful, user-friendly products. I care about clear, simple experiences that solve real problems and feel great to use.

Recently I’ve been creating two projects I’m proud of : a collaborative coding app where people can write and see results in real time, and a recon automation tool that speeds up the first stage of pentesting by scanning sites, crawling their pages, and surfacing hidden directories for review.

Last summer I completed a startup accelerator for a cybersecurity project. That experience sharpened how I scope ideas, ship quickly, and collaborate building a strong foundation in software design, problem-solving, and teamwork.

Beyond coding, I’m an avid Brazilian jiu-jitsu practitioner, a fitness enthusiast, and a runner. Those routines help me stay disciplined, keep a clear head, and keep exploring creative hobbies while planning my next big idea.
